name: wigwam
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a rounded structure made from a frame of poles covered with materials such as grass, cloth, or animal skins, lived in by Native Americans, especially in the northeastern US and Canada in the past: The children can sit in a birch-bark wigwam listening to a traditional story.
Marilyn Angel Wynn/Nativestock/GettyImages
a frame of sticks for supporting plants while they are growing: You can buy bamboo wigwams for your climbers. We grow our sweet peas on wigwams of six hazel sticks.
Jacky Parker Photography/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesShe had a new, boxy "government" home but in the backyard she kept a dome-shaped wigwam.In the centre of each wigwam, a fire burned constantly, and above it was a hole in the wigwam to let out the smoke.They established villages, their wigwams set closely together around a centre which was left open for games or ceremonies. For height, you can have wigwams of runner beans, sweet peas and clematis.

a cone-shaped tent made and lived in, esp. in the past, by American Indians in the eastern US
